\dfrac{x}{\left(x -1\right)^2\left(x +2\right)} = \dfrac{A}{x -1}+\dfrac{B}{\left(x -1\right)^2} + \dfrac{C}{x +2}\\ \implies x = A \left(x-1\right)\left(x+2\right)+B \left(x+2\right)+C \left(x-1\right)^2\\ \implies x =\left(A +C\right)x^2 + \left(A+B-2C\right)\\ \qquad\qquad\qquad\qquad\quad+\left(2B-2A+C\right)\\ \text{On comparing coefficients we get }A + C =0,\\ A + B - 2C = 1 \text{ and }2B -2A + C = 0\\ \text{Solve to get } A = \dfrac{2}{9},B = \dfrac{1}{3}\text{ and}C = \dfrac{-2}{9}
